wikipedia_page.main: Nicholas Eden, 2nd Earl of Avon, OBE TD DL   (3 October 1930 – 17 August 1985), styled Viscount Eden between 1961 and 1977, was a British Army officer and, later, a Conservative politician. He was the younger son of Prime Minister Sir Anthony Eden and his first wife, Beatrice (née Beckett).

response: *Nicholas Eden, 2nd Earl of Avon, British Army officer, Conservative politician, and younger son of Prime Minister Sir Anthony Eden

At his death, Eden was the last surviving member of Churchill's War Cabinet. Eden's surviving son, Nicholas Eden, 2nd Earl of Avon (1930–1985), known as Viscount Eden from 1961 to 1977, was also a politician and a minister in the Thatcher government until his death from AIDS at the age of 54.
* Nicholas Eden, 2nd Earl of Avon (1930–1985); served after the war as aide-de-camp to the Governor General of Canada.

link_mentions.page: List of children of prime ministers of the United Kingdom

response: Through his only surviving daughter, he was a grandfather of Charles Greville, 7th Earl of Warwick, the first British aristocrat to star in a Hollywood movie. Through his son Timothy, he was a grandfather of John Eden, Baron Eden of Winton (born 1925), a Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Bournemouth West. Through his son Anthony, he was the grandfather of three, including Nicholas Eden, 2nd Earl of Avon.
